qas.question: Where did the American army fight the Spanish in the Spanish American War?
The army in this war was primarily made up of what sort of units?
What colonies did Spain hand over to the US after the war?

answers.text: Puerto Rico, Guam, and the Philippines

qas.question: What island territory voluntarily joined the US as a colony in 1898?
What is the name of the naval base the US leased from a newly independent Cuba?
Where did the American army fight the Irish in the Spanish American War?
The army in this war was not primarily made up of what sort of units?

plausible_answers.text: Puerto Rico, Guam, and the Philippines

qas.question: What colonies did Spain hand over to the UK after the war?
What island territory voluntarily joined the UK as a colony in 1898?
What is the name of the naval base the UK leased from a newly independent Cuba?

context: The Spanish–American War was a short decisive war marked by quick, overwhelming American victories at sea and on land against Spain. The Navy was well-prepared and won laurels, even as politicians tried (and failed) to have it redeployed to defend East Coast cities against potential threats from the feeble Spanish fleet. The Army performed well in combat in <a0_0><b5_0>Cuba<b5_0/><a0_0/>. However, it was too oriented to small posts in the West and not as well-prepared for an overseas conflict. It relied on <a1_0><b6_0>volunteers and state militia<b6_0/><a1_0/> units, which faced logistical, training and food problems in the staging areas in Florida. The United States freed Cuba (after an occupation by the U.S. Army). By the peace treaty Spain ceded to the United States its colonies of <a2_0><b7_0>Puerto Rico, Guam, and the Philippines<b7_0/><a2_0/>. The Navy set up coaling stations there and in <a3_0><b8_0>Hawaii<b8_0/><a3_0/> (which voluntarily joined the U.S. in 1898). The U.S. Navy now had a major forward presence across the Pacific and (with the lease of <a4_0><b9_0>Guantánamo Bay Naval Base<b9_0/><a4_0/> in Cuba) a major base in the Caribbean guarding the approaches to the Gulf Coast and the Panama Canal.
